Description: Glazed composition. Upper part of a faience figure playing the lyre, with back pillar, which probabl;y indicates it was standing/or sitting. Modelling crude, with flaring out hair, large goggle eyes and poorly modelled features. Glaze all gone except for area of black brown on hair at back, core medium hard, porous cream colour, Typical product of Block Group.
Curator's comments: This piece belongs with the Block Group, which has a distribution outside Egypt, and is of later date than the fine Black and White Groups.
Bibliographic references: Webb 1978 / Archaic Greek Faience, Miniature scent bottles and related objects from East Greece, 650-500BC (402)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OM.11)
